Steven,
Thank you for your answer. 
Before, the cantera examples were converted  into xml format but not 
the tutorials for instance.
In fact, the problem came from the installation of Cantera. Since I 
disinstalled it and installed it again with the last nummerray 
version, it works well.
Regards,
Solene

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Steven C. DeCaluwe" <decal_12@y...> 
wrote:
> Solene,
> 
> Can you convert any other cti files into xml format?  If so, I 
would
> guess that your problem is somewhere in the syntax of your cti 
file. 
> I know that this is where most of my own errors come from.
> 
> Best of luck,
> Steven
> 
> 
> 
> --- se_deferrieres <De_Ferieres-S@u...> wrote:
> 
> > Dear Prof. Goodwin
> > I tried during these last days to find how files are converted 
> > into .xml file, because I think it is the key for solving my
> > problem.
> > I am using a 6.5 Student version of Matlab.
> > Maybe I forget something during the installation of Cantera and 
> > that's why a changed cti file can't convert into an xml file.
> > Do you have any idea where this problem come from?
> > I apologise for bothering you with such easy question.
> > 
> > Thanks
> > Solene
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "se_deferrieres" <De_Ferieres-
> > S@u...> wrote:
> > > Hello...
> > > I am trying to change the scheme of a H2/O2/Ar/N2, but I 
always 
> > get 
> > > this error:
> > > Procedure: ct2ctml
> > > Error:   could not convert input file to CTML
> > >  command line was: python C:\DOCUME~1\FireSERT\LOCALS~1
> > > \Temp/.cttmp1118422954.pyw> ct2ctml.log 2>&1
> > > 
> > > Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\ctmethods.dll
> > > Error in ==>
> > c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\@XML_Node\XML_Node.m
> > > On line 11  ==>    x.id = ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml
(name)
> > > 
> > > Error in ==>
> > c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\@Solution\Solution.m
> > > On line 30  ==> doc = XML_Node('doc',src);
> > > 
> > > Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\IdealGasMix.m
> > > On line 39  ==>        s = Solution(a);
> > > 
> > > Error in ==> 
> > > C:\Cantera\research\premixedflame\marinov\flameh2o2n2ar.m
> > > On line 43  ==> gas = IdealGasMix(rxnmech);
> > > 
> > > I have this error even with only one reaction and I can't find 
> > where 
> > > it came from.
> > > 
> > > help would be greatly appreciated!
> > > Solene
> > 
> > 
> >
